```{r}
library(ggplot2)
library(RColorBrewer)
```


```{r}
kernel_comp_data_and_spectra<-read_xlsx("../Data/Spectra_Data/spectra_learning_sets.xlsx")
kernel_comp_data <- kernel_comp_data_and_spectra[,c(1:23,165)]
head(kernel_comp_data)
```

```{r}
kernel_comp_moisture_sorted<-kernel_comp_data[order(kernel_comp_data$Moisture_Avg),]
kernel_comp_moisture_clustered <- kernel_comp_moisture_sorted[,c(7,23,16,11,17,10,20,8,21,14,15,22,9,13,12,19,18,24)]
```

```{r}
mycol <- colorRampPalette(c("#4575b4","#91bfdb","#e0f3f8","#fee090","#fc8d59","#d73027"))(256)

stats::heatmap(t(as.matrix(kernel_comp_moisture_clustered[,c(1:17)])),
               scale = "row", 
               col = mycol,
               Colv = NA, 
               #Rowv = NA,
               main = "Kernel Trait Heatmap",
               labCol = F) 
```

Yaniv would pull out moisture_avg and use it as scale.
